content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-024-09-B
|Item_parent=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Item_parent_short=Main complications of pregnancy.
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the frequency of hypertension
|Description=None
|Rubric=Epidemiology
|Contributors=Paul Berveiller,Philippe Deruelle
|Order=9}}

High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 5-10% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.

properties.question: High blood pressure during pregnancy affects 5-10% of pregnancies, and of these, 10% will develop pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_a: It is estimated that 15% of pregnancies experience high blood pressure, but only 5% will develop pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_b: High blood pressure is a significant risk factor for pre-eclampsia.
properties.option_c: Pre-eclampsia is a rare complication of pregnancy.
properties.option_d: Pregnant women with high blood pressure are at increased risk of pre-eclampsia.
